snippet: The departure of the administrator, Carole Post, comes as the city is challenging the release of a report on a much-delayed modernization of the city’s 911 system.
abstract: Carole Post, commissioner of New York City's Information Technology and Telecommunications Department, resigns; Post clashed repeatedly with city's deputy mayor for operations, Caswell F Holloway, over management of several signature initiatives of the Bloomberg administration, including city's 911 emergency system, plagued by cost overruns and performance issues.

byline.original: By DAVID M. HALBFINGER and MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM

lead_paragraph: The departure of the administrator, Carole Post, comes as the city is challenging the release of a report on a much-delayed modernization of the city’s 911 system.

headline.seo: New York’s Top Technology Official, Carole Post, Resigns
headline.main: City’s Top Technology Official Resigns Amid Clashes Over Troubled Projects
headline.print_headline: City’s Top Technology Official Resigns Amid Clashes Over Troubled Projects

keywords.value: Department of Information Technology and Telecommunications (NYC)
keywords.name: organizations
